citations.narrative:
The licensee does not currently have a contingency plan in place. Not having a contingency plan doesn't ensure the
facility will be prepared in the event of an emergency or disaster. The licensee must complete the contingency plan in
accordance with the requirements outlined in the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by 9/5/25.

An approximately 3 year old male husky named "Luke Nikolas VII" died on 12/8/24. The licensee found the dog hanging
by his arm in between the kennel door and front part of the kennel. It appears the dog most likely jumped up and pushed
the door somewhat forward in the process. While doing that the dog got its arm stuck and was unable to free himself
hanging there until he was found deceased.
Housing facilities must be designed so they are structurally sound and protect the animals from injury. The licensee must
ensure all his kennel doors don't allow for the dogs limbs to get stuck in the opening of the door between the gate the
kennel wall.
Correct starting on 8/5/25.

All six adult dogs are not current on their distemper or parvo shots. Not vaccinating all adult dogs against distemper and
parvo doesn't ensure those dogs are adequately protected against those diseases. All adult dogs must be vaccinated
against distemper and parvo and record must be kept documenting those vaccinations. Correct by 8/19/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The licensee does not currently have a contingency plan in place. Not having a contingency plan doesn't ensure the 
facility will be prepared in the event of an emergency or disaster. The licensee must complete the contingency plan in 
accordance with the requirements outlined in the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by 9/5/25. 
3.1(a)  Critical
   
Housing facilities, general. 
An approximately 3 year old male husky named "Luke Nikolas VII" died on 12/8/24. The licensee found the dog hanging 
by his arm in between the kennel door and front part of the kennel. It appears the dog most likely jumped up and pushed 
the door somewhat forward in the process. While doing that the dog got its arm stuck and was unable to free himself 
hanging there until he was found deceased. 
 
Housing facilities must be designed so they are structurally sound and protect the animals from injury. The licensee must 
ensure all his kennel doors don't allow for the dogs limbs to get stuck in the opening of the door between the gate the 
kennel wall. 
 
Correct starting on 8/5/25. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
All six adult dogs are not current on their distemper or parvo shots. Not vaccinating all adult dogs against distemper and 
parvo doesn't ensure those dogs are adequately protected against those diseases. All adult dogs must be vaccinated 
against distemper and parvo and record must be kept documenting those vaccinations. Correct by 8/19/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report.

n
